p.next: You have completed your mission

p.text: [p]``We're boarding that spaceship,'' you tell 2-Tor. The two of you rocket toward it. No one aboard seems to pay attention as you climb through an airlock into the ship. Once on the ship's bridge, you are puzzled by the crew.[/p] [p]``They're humanoids, Tor. But... it's as if they were photographic negatives.'' You brush your fingers warily on a crewmember.[/p] [p]You're thrown across the room. A nanosecond later Shockwaves and a loud roar hit you.[/p] [p]``Observation, boss,'' 2-Tor says. His blue lights caution you. ``These beings are made of negative energy. Contact with your positive energy could result in disaster.''[/p] [p]``Listen to the robot,'' a threatening voice says. ``Your suit saved your life, but my brother didn't have that kind of luck! He's dead - because you touched him!''[/p] [p]You wipe the smoke from your eyes and stare at the being who stands over you. ``Wh-what are you?''[/p]

[p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc4/97.jpg" /][/p] [p]``Negatoids. We come from a negative universe,'' the being says. '``We need energy for our galaxy. The sunworm devours stars. Then it changes their energy from positive to negative, and transfers the energy to our universe. We can't permit you to interfere.''[/p] [p]``That's monstrous,'' you shout ``If you take all our stars, our galaxy will die.''[/p] [p]The negatoid shrugs. ``Your universe is unimportant When your worlds are gone we'll take over here, too. But you'll die long before your galaxy...'' A blaster materializes in the Negatoid's hand. ``Good-bye.''[/p]

[p]``Dying doesn't exactly thrill me,'' you say. You trigger the [em]Challenger[/em]'s thrusters. ``But there's no time to think of a better plan.'' The shuttle blasts into the sunworm's great maw. Its shields begin to buckle under the tremendous heat in the creature's belly. The [em]Challenger[/em]'s control panel is too hot to touch.[/p] [p]``Get ready to warp us out of here, 2-Tor,'' you say. ``I'm going to trigger the shuttle's self-destruct circuit.''[/p] [p]``We shouldn't warp, boss,'' 2-Tor beeps. ``Too much stellar radiation around. I can't compute a warp-out point. We could reappear anywhere - a planet's crust or right back here.''[/p] [p]``There's no time to plan, 2-Tor! Warp!'' Your hand slaps the self-destruct button. You're no longer there.[/p] [p]You rematerialize in space, millions of miles away. In the distance the sunworm shifts from color to color. It explodes, spewing gas and radiation throughout the sector. From where you hover, it looks like a beautiful exploding sun.[/p]
p.next: You have completed your mission

p.text: [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc4/99.jpg" /][/p] [p]You slam on the [em]Challenger[/em]'s thrusters and rocket out of the starship's path. A puff of light, like a tiny comet, rushes at you from the starship.[/p] [p]``Negation torpedo, boss,'' 2-Tor bleeps. ``Our shields can't stand up to it There's not a chance in Nyx we can outrun it. Abandon ship?''[/p] [p]``You said it, 2-Tor.'' Both of you leap through the emergency airlock.[/p] [p]The [em]Challenger[/em] vanishes in a soft puff of black light. Shock waves press you against the hull of the starship. You are still there moments later when erewmembers arrive to pull you from the hull.[/p] [p]``Do we attack, boss?'' 2-Tor whistles.[/p] [p]``We'll find out what's going on a lot easier if we get ourselves captured, Tor. Put up shields only if they try to hurt us.'' The crew hauls you into the starship.[/p] [p]Soon you face the starship's captain. Half his body is human, but the other half is a machine covered with plastic skin. He glares at you with a computerized eye.[/p] [p]``[em]He's a cyborg,[/em]'' 2-Tor thoughtcasts to you.[/p] [p]``Shhh!'' you say. ``He's going to speak!''[/p]

[p]``[em]How about making a deal?[/em]'' you ask.[/p] [p]The Hive laughs. ``[em]We do not make deals with inferior beings.[/em]''[/p] [p]You try to move, but the Hive has stolen control of your body. A single spiraloid rises to your forehead. It unwinds to form a living link between you and the starbody. You feel your mind sliding down the spiraloid. In that moment you are one with the spiraloids and the supermind.[/p] [p]You imagine a horrible disaster. The Hive explodes in flames like a small nova star, scorching and slaughtering millions of spiraloids.[/p] [p]The vision is too much for the Hive. In panic, it lets you go, to slide back into your body. It may have been the stronger intellect, but you have the more powerful imagination.[/p] [p]``You must not go free,'' the Hive snarls as it regains control. ``If you will not serve us, you must die.''[/p]
p.next: If you want to try to destroy the Hive
If you decide to call for help

p.text: [p]``We can't trust Kobold,'' you tell 2-Tor. ``Where's his transmission coming from?''[/p] [p]``My sensors read that he is three decks up,'' 2-Tor replies. ``I compute that he is setting a trap for us.''[/p] [p]``Only a Vegan wobat would walk in Kobold's front door, 2-Tor. It'll sap our power, but I want to cut through these walls and sneak up on him.''[/p] [p]Your micro-pulsers melt the ship's wall to slag. You picture the look that will be on the commander's face when you burst in on him. ``Deck Three coming up,'' 2-Tor beeps. ``Get ready, boss!''[/p] [p]The wall melts away. You leap onto the bridge. A dozen armed aliens surround you. All are ready to pulser you into oblivion.[/p] [p]``We were expecting your little trick,'' Commander Kobold says with a smirk. ``Farewell, [em]Nebula [/em]operative.''[/p]

[p]``There's a way to give Bront his hunt and end it at the same time,'' you say. ``Do you have any spare robot parts around here?''[/p] [p]Longhaul blinks. ``Aye, but...''[/p] [p]``Show us the way,'' you say. Moments later Longhaul leads you into an old workshop. It hasn't been used in years. Computer chips and bits of machinery litter the floor.[/p] [p]``Access the [em]Nebula[/em], 2-Tor. We need plans for vidscreens and hologram projectors.'' The robot clicks and whirs.[/p] [p]``Got it, boss,'' 2-Tor says. ``Let's get started.''[/p] [p]For long hours you and 2-Tor put together chips and circuits. Finally you hold up a helmet. ``Finished!'' you say. ``The hunt for the starsnipe is over.''[/p] [p]``What good is that?'' Longhaul says. ``It doesn't even have eyeholes.''[/p] [p]``You'll see,'' you say. ``Let's get to the captain's cabin.[/p]

[p]You leap for safety outside the Hive. Chaos is all around you. As you crash to the planet's surface, the Hive whispers in your brain. ``[em]You... have unleashed our stolen... stellar energy.... Everything will be destroyed... destroyed... dest...[/em]'' It fades away as the planet erupts around you.[/p] [p]``Scan the area, 2-Tor! Any trace of the Hive or the spiraloids?''[/p] [p]``Negative!'' 2-Tor whistles. ``They've been consumed. We'll join them shortly unless you think of something. Our power is very low.''[/p] [p]``There's one chance!'' you reply. ``This is stellar energy raging around us. Tap into it with your energy collectors.''[/p] [p]``Good idea, boss!'' 2-Tor's lights flash green. ``The energy will power our shields for as long as the starfire burns.''[/p] [p]Your shields surround you. For a long time you watch the planet of the spiraloids burn to cinders around you. Finally you share the planet only with ashes. The Hive is gone for good.[/p] [p]``Access the [em]Nebula [/em]for a lift,'' you tell 2-Tor. ``We're going home.''[/p]
p.next: You have completed your mission

p.text: [p]You thoughtcast to the Hive, ``[em]I've never seen a life form like you. Tell me about yourself.[/em]''[/p] [p]``[em]You need know nothing more than your fate,[/em]'' the Hive beams back. You try to switch on your shields. But you can't move your hand. ``[em]We have taken control of your body,[/em]'' the Hive says. ``[em]You will not need it soon.[/em]''[/p] [p]You rise and float as the Hive takes you farther into itself. In the center there is a humanoid body many times larger than yours.[/p] [p]``[em]We formed this body from the solidified light of a thousand stars,[/em]'' the Hive says. ``[em]We created it to explore an unknown dimension we discovered. It is a place that might be too much for even the starbody. The starbody needs a mind to control it - your mind.[/em]''[/p]
p.next: If you go along with the Hive's plans
If you suggest a different plan

p.text: [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc4/105.jpg" /][/p] [p]``That cored star is weird!'' you tell 2-Tor. ``Access the Nebula. We need a science officer out here.''[/p] [p]Light flashes out of nowhere, and Dr. Leonus, a scientist from the [em]Nebula[/em], appears. He's a powerfullooking, razor-toothed humanoid, but a gentle scientist ``Let's see this star,'' he says.[/p]

[p]``You should know why you have to die,'' Kobold says. ``I stole a weapon that I like to call a sun destroyer. It blows up suns, creates them, steals their energy. It's wonderful! I'm going to use it to make the Network of Worlds pay me lots of money. I might destroy their suns anyway, just for fun. I like to destroy for fun. Of course, I have to destroy you first, or you'll give away my plans. Ready... aim...''[/p] [p]``[em]Wait![/em]'' you shout. ``My bio-support suit will detonate if I'm killed. Destroy me and the explosion will rip apart this ship!''[/p] [p]``He's bluffing,'' Kobold snarls. But the other aliens cringe and lower their weapons.[/p] [p]Kobold grabs a pulser and fires. Your bio-support suit explodes, taking the ship with you, as you promised. The commander and his sun destroyer are wiped out ``I've destroyed [em]myself[/em],'' Kobold says with his dying breath. ``That was [em]really [/em]fun!'' Then all of you float lifelessly in space.[/p] [p class="end"]ZAP![/p]

[p]It's obvious that the Saurans won't give up unless you scare them.[/p] [p]``[em]Give the stellar-stealer just enough of a blast to dent the shell, 2-Tor,[/em]'' you thoughtcast. ``[em]That should scare them.[/em]''A pulserbolt ripples from your suit across the metal skin of the stellar-stealer. The machine buckles. Light glows from beneath the metal. The Saurans scream and stop in their tracks.[/p] [p]``Don't destroy us!'' the ancient Sauran hisses. ``We surrender!''[/p] [p]``Why were you stealing stars?'' you ask.[/p] [p]``We planned to smash the Network of Worlds with the energy. Then we would take over. We needed your warper so we could launch a sneak attack.''[/p] [p]But the Saurans' schemes are finished. 2-Tor has already accessed the [em]Nebula[/em]. Captain Polaris is sending a squad to take the Saurans to a prison asteroid. A science team will return the stolen energy to the stars.[/p]
p.next: You have completed your mission

p.text: [p]``[em]I'll mindmeld with your starbody on one condition,[/em]'' you thoughtcast to the Hive. ``[em]Stop stealing stars![/em]'' The Hive buzzes furiously, as if it were arguing with itself.[/p] [p]Finally it replies. ``[em]Agreed![/em]'' A spiraloid touches your forehead with its antennae. Your mind is yanked from your body and floats over the scene. Your body lies on the Hive floor, and spiraloids swarm over it. 2-Tor's sensors track the creature carrying your mind across the room.[/p] [p]The spiraloid burns up as it touches the starbody. For a long time you feel yourself falling into a bright light. You stand up and raise a hand in front of your eyes. The hand glows. You are in the starbody, filled with more power than you have ever felt.[/p] [p]There is a buzzing in your head, even though the Hive isn't casting thoughts at you. You realize that the starbody can read the Hive's mind. It doesn't know you can hear it. What you hear angers you. The Hive already plots to steal more stars. You know it won't live up to its part of the bargain. Should you keep your part?[/p]
p.next: If you carry out your part of the bargain
If you want to end the bargain

p.text: [p]You snatch the beacon from Bront's hand. ``I'm sorry,'' you say. ``This is too important to leave up to a madman. Can we warp to the starsnipe and back, Tor?''[/p] [p]``Aye, aye, sir,'' 2-Tor whistles. ``I mean... sure.''[/p] [p]You disappear in a flash of light. Microseconds later you appear on the starsnipe's hide. It is rock. Up close the monster looks like an asteroid that stretches to infinity. You jam the beacon into a crack in the stone.[/p] [p]``Warp us back, 2-Tor.''[/p] [p]``I can't, boss.'' His red lights blink. ``A magnetic field here is messing up my circuits.''[/p] [p]Bront's ships arrive. They crash into the starsnipe and burrow under its skin. The rocky skin begins to erupt. ``So long, 2-Tor,'' you say. ``It's been nice knowing you.''[/p] [p]``You give up too easily, sports,'' Captain Bront says over your communicator. Gravity beams pull you and 2-Tor off the starsnipe. A moment later the monster falls apart, leaving space littered with stone. ``We beat the beastie, we did!'' Bront says. ``My life is complete.''[/p]
p.next: You have completed your mission

p.text: [p]``That sunworm brainwave you picked up, 2-Tor. Is it any language we can understand?'' you ask.[/p] [p]``I'm checking, boss. Did you know there are at least seven million languages currently spoken in the civilized galaxy? Three times as many were once used - Hold it! It sounds like a language spoken by giants that live on the edge of the known universe. What have you got in mind?''[/p] [p]``Patch me into a mindlink if you can,'' you say. ``Translate my thoughts into the language of the giants. I'm going to try to talk with the sunworm.''[/p] [p]But even when the broadcast is sent, the monster doesn't answer. Instead, it devours the last bit of the star - and then it turns toward you.[/p]
p.next: If you want to keep trying to communicate
If you decide to defend yourself

p.text: [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc4/111.jpg" /][/p] [p]``[em]Nebula[/em] operatives don't squeal!'' you tell the leader of the Vend. His eyes pop open wide with anger. ``2-Tor! Access this starship's computers. We're taking over!''[/p] [p]``You can't do that,'' the leader says. He snickers. ``That meganium toy is too small. It doesn't have the power.''[/p] [p]``Don't be too sure. 2-Tor! Switch off the magnetic field that holds the star open in ten seconds. Stop only if this Vend clown surrenders.''[/p] [p]``Boss...'' 2-Tor's lights flash red. ``There's something you should know...''[/p] [p]``Your robot wants to tell you that I'm linked into ship's computers,'' the Vend leader says. He pulls off his face. Computer chips and circuitry hum and glint all over its face.[/p] [p]``You're a robot,'' you gasp.[/p] [p]A crackling laugh erupts from the leader's head. ``You'll never reveal my secret!''[/p] [p]A hatch opens. Like old garbage, you are dumped into the sun.[/p] [p class="end"]ZAP![/p]

[p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/sc4/112.jpg" /][/p] [p]``Do you mean we should give that monster a cosmic bellyache?'' the Attack Team leader gasps. ``Even if your idea would work, we haven't got any free energy left!''[/p] [p]``The [em]Challenger[/em] is burning up with energy,'' you reply. ``We absorbed it from the stasis web.''[/p] [p]``But there's only one way to get that energy into the sunworm - fly it in personally,'' the team leader says. ``And that would kill you. Think of another plan.''[/p]
p.next: If you think you can risk flying into the sunworm
If you'd rather think of another plan

p.text: [p]``I know that creature is an intelligent being,'' you tell 2-Tor. ``We can't take the chance of destroying it! We have to stop the Attack Team. We have to prove the sunworm thinks.''[/p] [p]``There are signs of intelligence, boss,'' 2-Tor beeps. ``Nothing I'd call conclusive.''[/p] [p]``You know [em]Nebula[/em] regulations, Tor. If there's even a question, we should preserve intelligent life.'' You zip the [em]Challenger[/em] between the squad and the sunworm. A message crackles across your communicator.[/p] [p]``I don't care what your status on the [em]Nebula[/em] is,'' the Attack Team leader says. ``Get that shuttlecraft out of the way or we'll blow you to Ansales-C! You're protecting a threat to the Network of Worlds.''[/p]
p.next: If you face off against the Attack Team
If you try to prove the sunworm is intelligent
